Reviews.Title: I almost sent it back
Reviews.Author: Michael Friant
Reviews.Content: When I got my Aspire I realized that it did not come with a DVD/CD drive, it bothered me a little, but when I could not get the computer to recognize another device through the USB port I almost sent it back.  Luckily I figured out the problem and kept the computer.  I really love how slender it is, it is fast and responsive and will play computer games I like to play, and with a 1 terabyte hard drive I'm not seeing or worrying about it slowing down do to low memory space.  The 8 gigs of ram helps keep every thing moving fast (a lot faster than my desk top).  Most importantly being able to play my favorite game somewhere other than my desk top made my wife happy.  I was going to go with 4 stars, but my happy wife pushed it back to five stars.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic laptop for a great price. Great for work, gaming, multitasking.
Reviews.Author: isaxman
Reviews.Content: I really like this computer so far! I'm not a computer expert or anything, but here were my overall impressions:Pros:Hard Drive (1 TB): Plenty of storage space and doesn't take too long to load or boot either! I've heard some people replace theirs with a SSD to speed things up, but I don't feel the need to as this this runs pretty quick and smooth already.Processor (AMD A10 5757) great for gaming. Some people prefer the higher end i7s which is cool, but from what I've seen, this is a great processor especially for the price.Graphics (Radeon HD 8750M) Having 2gb of dedicated graphics memory is awesome. The graphics and frame rates are great for gaming. You can find a bunch of benchmark tests online, and I haven't tested for them myself, but every game I've tried so far has been extremely smooth on high settings. That includes Skyrim, Half Life 2, Mass Effect 2 & 3, The Stanley Parable, and Fallout 3. Granted, some of these are slightly older games, and I haven't seen how games like Battlefield 3 & 4 will perform yet. But so far, this thing has been super solid for gaming.Keyboard: I'm actually a big fan of the keyboard. It feels very accurate and has a number pad as well.Size, Weight, and Appearance: This thing is so thin and light! It's metallic finish also looks really cool.Battery: The battery life seems pretty average. It's hard for me to give a time estimate as it depends on what you're using it for. Netflix and games seem to run out the battery considerably fast which is to be expected. But overall, you can get around 3 hours of battery with heavy use and more with lighter use. Also, there's a power saver option that's easy to turn on.Screen: I actually like the screen. It's pretty crisp, however it isn't full HD.Windows 8: This may be an unpopular opinion, but I really like Windows 8. I've heard that people have issues with it slowing down their computer, but with the processor and GPU on this thing, it doesn't seem to be an problem. It's very sleek and so far, works great especially with a computer as fast as this one.Multitasking: I've had multiple large downloads going at once while watching netflix and running a bunch of other programs on this thing just to see how it would fair. Didn't slow it down even a little. Download speeds were slowed, but not by much. Ex. about 2.5 mb/s on both Steam and Origin at the same time while browsing the web.Cons (not many):Track pad: It kind of sucks because the right and left mouse buttons are a part of the pad itself which makes it hard to click on anything without moving the mouse. It's not really that bad and gets better the more you get used to it, but it's easily remedied with an optical mouse. (highly recommend for gaming)No CD/DVD drive!!!: This might be hard on some people, but I find I rarely end up needing to use a disk drive anyway. I ended up buying a $25 LG super portable USB CD/DVD burner drive that works very well when I need it and so the lack of a built in drive is a non-issue for me.The screen: I'm not sure where to put the screen on this list. Yeah it's not full HD, but for a 720p screen, it looks good, and I find myself not caring too much.Overheating: Both the power supply and the laptop can run a little hot when you're running a lot of things. It's not a huge concern, and also something to be expected I guess, but it's something to keep an eye on....Overall, I highly recommend this laptop. Do your research, but you'll probably come back to this one for the price range.

Reviews.Title: One of the best laptops that I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Brady
Reviews.Content: This laptop is slim, lightweight, yet powerful. I am able to play games like Minecraft, L4D2, Starbound, and Oblivion all on max settings with no problem. The only "problems" that I noticed with this laptop are so minor that they're not even worth mentioning. On a side note, Windows 8 just takes some getting used to, it's not as horrible as most people claim it to be. You may or you may not like Windows 8 but I'm telling you it's fairly easy to get used to.

Reviews.Title: If you don't care about a touchscreen or optical drive, this is the laptop to go for.
Reviews.Author: James Juett
Reviews.Content: Well constructed, attractive, doesn't get fingerprinted easily.Very good specs for the price.  No optical drive or touchscreen, but more than makes up for it elsewhere.Very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: value priced gaming system
Reviews.Author: Eagle One
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive gaming system that handles my RTS games at med to high settings.  Easy to setup and works great right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive Gaming System
Reviews.Author: Flynn Arrowstarr
Reviews.Content: I bought this system to use as a light gaming machine and I ended up being surprised at how well it works with my newer games. First, I want to explain why I rated it four stars as opposed to five stars. On its own, the laptop is very capable, but it does get warm and the fans will blow constantly while playing games. Also, the hard drive is a definite bottleneck in the system, which does hurt the system's performance. However, replace the hard drive with a solid state drive (make sure you get a 7mm drive), max the memory to 12 GB and get a cooling pad, this laptop is an easy five star rating.Specs are available in a number of places. I don't have a lot to say on this other than once you get used to the keyboard, it works quite well. The biggest issue is the lack of status lights on the system. No Caps Lock, Num Lock or Scroll Lock indicators, no hdd activity lights. These are remedied with software easily enough. For those asking, this does not have a touchscreen nor a backlit keyboard. No optical drive is included, but a USB DVD drive can be had for less than $40.The Aspire V5-552G-X852 ships with the original Windows 8. Acer does not supply Windows 7 drivers for this laptop, but if you search online you can find instructions for installing Windows 7 that aren't too terribly difficult to follow. Why Windows 7? Well, as much as I like Windows 8.1 (it's not as bad as people say it is), I tend to run a lot of older games which don't necessarily play nice with Windows 7, let alone Windows 8.Okay, so now you may be asking yourself, what games have I tested with the laptop and what are the results? Well, I don't have any testing software, so these notes will be based on my own observations, not on "serious" testing. I do have 12 GB memory in the system, a cooling mat and the stock 5400 rpm hdd. Your mileage may vary:Minecraft - I see this question asked and yes, the laptop does run Minecraft pretty well. I don't have all the settings maxed, but the game plays smoothly for the most part. There are some slowdowns when you first start the game as it is loading the world around you.Skyrim - I'm running this with AA set to 8x and Anisotropic at 16x. No major slowdowns that I've seen so far. However, I haven't run into a dragon or major battle yet, so this may change.The Sims 3 - A little disappointed that the system can't run this game well at full detail, but it runs okay at medium-high settings. The hard drive is a serious bottleneck here as loading the game takes long enough, but then saved games can take up to 5 minutes to load as well.Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning - Max settings, no slowdowns that I've seen so far. This includes combat with multiple enemies.Dragon Age games - Dragon Age: Origins plays well at max settings. Dragon Age II plays nearly as well, but there is some stuttering in the animation while walking. Combat doesn't seem to stutter, so I'm thinking the hard drive bottleneck may be coming in to play.BioShock Infinite - Limited testing at both medium and full settings, the game runs fine. No real slowdowns detected.I've tested a number of other games as well, but these are my usual stress testing games. So again, overall the system exceeded my expectations. With a decent sized solid state drive, it could be an even faster system. Definitely recommended for gaming on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: Sherri Beyster
Reviews.Content: My son was always snagging my computer, so it was time to buy him his own laptop.  He only uses it for school work and Minecraft and he has had no lag or problems with it. LOVE LOVE LOVE the price! And it is so very light!

Reviews.Title: Touch/mouse pad sucks!
Reviews.Author: C. Fierro
Reviews.Content: The left and right click is part of the sensitivity of the pad, so every time you touch the left or right click buttons...the cursor jumps for no reason.  When doing anything that includes the left or right mouse pad buttons, expect to play a game to fight with your cursor to click what you want it to.  Windows 8 works as well as 7, and works well if you are a gamer, unless you try using the mouse pad of course.  But all Windows 8 did is take the start menu, place it in front of the desktop and replace folders with apps.  So now, its like it automatically brings up your start menu, before you can get to your desktop.  In short, Windows 8 functions well but the interface sucks. Otherwise great computer for gaming, as long as you're using an external mouse or control pad.

Reviews.Title: Good Computer But Unexpected Graphic Cards
Reviews.Author: Adam B.
Reviews.Content: Everything about the computer works fine and well. The specifications aren't completely correct though. The graphics card is actually Radeon HD 8650G + 8750M Dual. The 8650g is integrated and the 8750m is dedicated. You can run new games fine on medium settings but older games may not be compatible with two graphic cards. Your computer will only use the integrated graphics card if you play older games.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Darwin S.
Reviews.Content: I only recommend this pc to Gamers !!!! Playing battlefield 4 now, on medium-high 40-60 fps.Its light and the sound its amazing.

Reviews.Title: Fine laptop, but it was previously used
Reviews.Author: Tom Landry
Reviews.Content: Nowhere does Amazon mention that this laptop is refurbished.  I turned it on only to discover that someone had already set up the machine!  I can tell you that this person was Chinese (from the language settings) and completely colorblind (from the garish theme).  He/she had already removed most of the bloatware and added a bunch of easily removable junk of his/her own.Also, the webcam makes me look fat.  Other than that it works fine.

Reviews.Title: Very good... for games
Reviews.Author: GETULIO ALBERTO DE SOUZA CRUZ FILHO
Reviews.Content: Very good for games with Dota 2, StarCraft 2 and Residente Evil 6... But the AMD processor A10 5757 is so lazy... The HD is very slow too, i think to buy a SSD to start faster...

Reviews.Title: affordable and good for gaming.
Reviews.Author: vito filip
Reviews.Content: This laptop is quite good for gaming and affordable than any other units comparable to its specs. I had a hard time adjusting to the Pre installed windows 8 OS but I think I can get used to it. The sound is very very good, the four built-in speakers does a great job. For movies and gaming. Battery life is a bit low, but I think I can manage using the power cord most of the time.

Reviews.Title: I did many test
Reviews.Author: John Vera
Reviews.Content: This laptop is very good, first when you power on is quickly, second the processor is very good performe in all process like play game, manage external disk, try to recover formated disk and use office all in the same time.The last thing is the Radeon HD 8750M is a very good dedicated card graphic, i like games like call of duty ghost in high settings, well use the dual graphics Radeon for games is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Laptop!
Reviews.Author: Lisa Witkowski
Reviews.Content: Great laptop! Very fast, powerful processor. Graphics card is great, runs many games easily on high settings. Love this thing!

Reviews.Title: Very powerful and fast for its price range!
Reviews.Author: Joyce H. Gerbe "Dr Armistice"
Reviews.Content: This is an unbelievable laptop for the price ($600). My old laptop's power supply just cut one day and i was in desperate need of a new one. I had already been eying this one and now had a good reason to get it.PROS-light-very thin (no disk drive)-1 Radeon HD 8750M graphics card and 1 Radeon  8650M graphics car if i recall correctly (dual cards)-can run all current games on medium and a good number on high-power jack on the back( this is a preference) I like it on the back so you can sit any where and it doesn't matter where the cord has to go :) just nice- 2gb dedicated VRAM- up to 12gb RAMCONS-since it is so thin its not going to be as durable as a thicker laptop (but who is going to really test that other than by being reckless?)-the mouse pad is god awful don't even try it! just do yourself a favor and get a portable wireless mouse... that's what i did-the display is nothing amazing 720p then again its not awful so there's that-there are only 3 usb ports... not a huge problem but sometime inconvenientOverall this is a fantastic computer for the everyday user and a steal for a PC gamer. of course not what a hardened PC gamer needs but it does get the job done the gamer on the go and on a budget (like me hahaa)

Reviews.Title: Excellent Low budget gaming laptop.
Reviews.Author: Joey Surico
Reviews.Content: No complaints what so ever. Had to get a USB dvd rom drive for it. Well built. Always loved AMD.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Jamie Walters
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop primarily for when I have to work from home in the evening and when I travel.But I also wanted something I could do some modern casual gaming with. I cut my teeth on the Atari 2600 and I am a little old school with my FPS games CSGO, CoD, TF2, etc. but they run great on high settings and frankly I have not found anything in my steam library that wont play at all. I am also running running Skyrim and ESO on high settings. Spreadsheets, word docs, movies, etc. all look great too. I don't think you can beat the performance and value. Way to go Acer, AMD and Ammazon!

Reviews.Title: Great Computer
Reviews.Author: h.eff.
Reviews.Content: I wanted a computer that I would be able to do school work and still play some games *cough*Sims*cough*. I knew pretty much any computer can run Sims fantastic graphic card or not, but I liked that this one had a great graphics card and plenty of  memory.I saw that it didn't come with a disc drive though, but I happened to have a portable one that works just fine with it. I actually like the lack of disc drive because it makes it lighter when I carry it.All of my programs run fantastically smooth and I have no game lag at all.I even downloaded LoL and Archeblade and had no issues with either of those games.It's a great laptop whether you want it for basic browsing or mediocre gaming.

Reviews.Title: Excelent for the price but there are things that can be better
Reviews.Author: Kenvis
Reviews.Content: As many people said, this is a good laptop for the price. Decent for gaming (most in medium settings) and at least good for software development and the battery life is good.But still has lacks in some aspects:-No status light indicator-No backlit keyboard-The fans is noisy-The track pad has some issues with the buttons.-Windows 8 (I have installed Ubuntu and works great!!)

Reviews.Title: Puts the "Fun" in "Functional".....
Reviews.Author: Trauma_queen
Reviews.Content: Excellent laptop for the price. Was looking for something for basic online gaming and this is it! Haven't had a single problem, I get good frame rate on most games, has good battery life for when I'm not gaming and I want to go outside and get some work done. All around, this is a good laptop for all my basic needs.

Reviews.Title: The fan definitely works...
Reviews.Author: Andrea D.
Reviews.Content: This is the loudest laptop I've ever used. I seriously try not to use it for class because it's just loud enough to be a problem during lecture. I wouldn't recommend this product for students. (unless for private use/gaming, of course) When I'm in a room full of laptops, mine establishes the dominant sound.At least it's got an effective fan...(I'm obviously ill-equipped in technical matters, but I feel like the noise factor is worth mentioning.)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Performer
Reviews.Author: Dustin
Reviews.Content: All I can say is wow! I cannot believe how fantastic this computer is for the price ($589 at time of purchase). It easily has the loudest speakers I have ever heard on a laptop and they sound very rich with little to no distortion turned all the way up. The "surround" is believable and noticeable (sound feels like its next to your ears, not just projecting towards you). This computer is very snappy and handles gaming very well. It has gotten a little warm (top of keyboard area) when I have played Elder Scrolls Online (does mostly high level graphics very stable) for a couple of hours but the fans extract the heat very well. The screen can seem a little flimsy but you shouldn't be poking or pressing on the screen anyways; other than that the build quality is very nice. The only minor complaint I have about this laptop is how loud the fans can be, but they do their job very well and their function well outweighs the noise level, especially since the speakers can easily drown out said noise. I would rather have a cool running laptop that can be a little loud than a blistering one that is quiet. This is easily the best <$600 I have ever spent on a piece of tech and I am surprised this laptop is not in the $700-800 range. I would also include a complaint about the track pad but since I use a wireless mouse it does not bother me, and Windows 8 feels like it needs a touchscreen but I am running Class Shell (gives you a start button) and it doesn't feel a lot different from Windows 7.Summary: If you want a slim-line 15.6" gorgeous laptop, with fantastic speakers, than can handle gaming, this has to be the best bang for your buck laptop out there.

Reviews.Title: Great so far
Reviews.Author: Craig Hirt
Reviews.Content: very slim and light weight.  No CD drive but easily connected to an external CD drive.I like the higher level graphics card.  Probably more than I needed to to play WoW but it runs excellent on this computer.One of the few computers I could find in this price range with a decent graphics card.

Reviews.Title: Is perfect!
Reviews.Author: Arnaldo F
Reviews.Content: I'm a student, and i bought this laptop for desing and work perfect. Also i play some video games, and i dont have any problem.

Reviews.Title: My first Acer
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Flora
Reviews.Content: It is really different than a Mac but I am getting used to windows 8 and I really like it

Reviews.Title: Really good computer for the price
Reviews.Author: Alexander b wire
Reviews.Content: I rated it a four star even though it should be a five star because of these reasons. Firstly when you open the task manager it says that you have 1 of 2 slots free for ram, however, when you open it to look at the components there is only one place for the ram the other ram is actually built into the motherboard. Secondly, do run higher profile games and it functions properly on medium to high quality, but when I go to play Minecraft on full screen it starts to have image "ribbon flares" across the screen near your hand.It is a really good computer for the price. For 600 dollars I would recommend it to everyone. The only downside for the good components it does posses it's windows 8 without a touchscreen and it has now CD player. I get around the no CD play just fine, but not having a touchscreen does affect the quality of windows 8.Thanks Acer!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: ashli113
Reviews.Content: My first laptop in a long time. I was recommended to this by a friend who has the model just under this one. I like everything about it except that the touch pad is left-oriented. What's up with that? I use the whole screen, not just the left side. Also, because I'm reaching from the right, I swipe the pad so that the search bar thing/control panel comes up and that can be a little annoying. The only other thing I find wrong is that it randomly turns off (it's happened about 3 times). All of my screens are restored and I never lose anything but it's extremely annoying. On a more positive note, lots and lots of storage, the screen is AWESOME, it's nice and thin, I can pick up with one hand easily and the sound is amazing. I would definitely purchase again!

Reviews.Title: There Are Better Computers
Reviews.Author: Pearson Moore
Reviews.Content: I recently traded in my desktop computers for laptops. I purchased the Acer Aspire V5-552G-X852 and the Asus X750J laptop and use both in my work. Though the two computers cost about the same, the Asus laptop is by far the better computer. The keyboard feels sturdy and I'm less likely to hit the wrong key or multiple keys, and the feel of the computer is superior. The Acer Aspire, on the other hand, seems to have been slapped together with little thought given to design. The power button is squirreled away on the left edge of the computer, not above the keyboard as one would expect. The only USB-3 port is on the back side of the computer, which seems a retro-1980s kind of thing to do, since using a modern peripheral becomes challenging, especially when the laptop is wired to power and other peripherals. I have to turn off the unit, fold down the screen, and unplug one or more peripherals just so I can access the USB-3 port. Bad design!! The headphone jack failed after only a few uses. I purchased several peripherals, all of which work perfectly on the Acer Aspire, but many of these work poorly or not at all on the Asus X750J. All in all, the computer is functional, but minimally so. I decided on the Acer Aspire based on its highly-touted graphics package, but after running challenging games and other graphics-heavy software on both units, the Asus laptop is always just as good if not better. If I had known this BEFORE purchasing, I would have gone with two Asus units and skipped over the Acer. It was a $600 mistake, and not one I am likely to repeat. The Acer unit is acceptable, but I recommend other computers. I'm finding the Asus laptop everything I hoped it would be. HP computers, also, have always served me well. You may have other reasons for preferring the Acer over other computers. Maybe you see it on sale. I recommend spending a bit more money on something you'll be satisfied with, rather than plunking down cash for a computer you'll quickly dislike.

Reviews.Title: READ THIS
Reviews.Author: BERNHARDT TORRES
Reviews.Content: The machine is great and I know that. Hardware specs are awesome and I got a free Battlefield 4 game for my purchase, sweet.I knew the risks of buying a "cheap" laptop from outside the U.S., but did not expect this:1.- Right out of the package I opened the laptop and *clack*... left hinge broken... are you kidding me?2.- IT CAME WITH NO OS!!!! NO OS AT ALL!!! Can't boot my laptop because it came with no freaking OS!!! Unbelievable.I'm contacting Amazon and/or Acer right now... I'll edit my post to add a support review. So far I'm frustrated and dissapointed

Reviews.Title: Loud and annoying fan, windows 8 deserves the hate
Reviews.Author: Jimmy W
Reviews.Content: This computer is fine for what it is. It is generally fast enough, does what I ask it to.Two BIG problems to be aware of:First, all the hype is true, Windows8 is absolutely horrible. I am an average computer user who got this for work. I am trying to use outlook, powerpoint, excel, and am browsing the web. That is it. And Windows8 just keeps on trying to insert itself in the middle of the process. Idiotic and unnecessary "apps" keep popping up and taking over the screen. Please quit trying to be so "smart" and just execute the commands I am giving you.Second, the fan is VERY loud and runs in an annoyingly inconsistent and short pattern. What I mean is, over the course of writing this review, the fan has turned itself on and off three times. That gets distracting really fast when it is a loud fan to begin with. It would be one thing if it ran every once in a while, but this constant on-off is driving me mad. The computer is sitting on a flat desk and has plenty of air flow, doesn't help. I even set it up to get more air flow by propping it up at the edges, made no difference.Fourth time just started.

Reviews.Title: Machine delivered with Virus
Reviews.Author: Jerick
Reviews.Content: This 'new' machine was delivered to us with an existing virus.  The machine was corrupted with malware and was unusable.  Unfortunately, it did just enough to connect to the internet, hook to our home network  and potentially infect our other machines (which thankfully were protected by anti-malware systems), before it became completely unusable.  Very frustrating.

ProductInfo.Features:
AMD Quad-Core A10-5757M 2.5 GHz Processor (4 MB Cache)
8 GB DDR3 RAM
1 TB 5400 rpm Hard Drive
15.6-Inch Screen, AMD Radeon HD 8750M
Windows 8, 4.5-hour battery life
ProductInfo.Name: Acer Aspire V5-552G-X852 15.6-Inch Laptop (Cool Steel)
